title: Ensuring a Lawful and Accurate Enumeration and Apportionment Pursuant to the Decennial Census

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs that the population counts used for congressional representation after the decennial census must include all residents of each state, regardless of immigration status, reversing a prior policy that sought to exclude undocumented immigrants. It emphasizes the importance of an accurate and lawful enumeration consistent with the Constitution and federal law.
potential_concerns: State or local governments might face challenges adjusting districting processes if census data is delayed or disputed due to changes in population counting methods.
Some stakeholders may argue that including undocumented immigrants in apportionment could affect political power balances and resource allocation controversies.
Ensuring data accuracy without relying on incomplete immigration status records may complicate quality assurance efforts and increase operational burdens on the Census Bureau.
Reversing prior policies might lead to legal challenges or political disputes regarding the interpretation of census statutes and constitutional requirements.
